page.title: 14PLAISTOW CHURCH AND CHAPEL
page.content:
{The Church is called The Holy Trinity. It was built in 1856. In the old times a little boy pumped air into the organ quite fast, then the organist could play. There is one bell in the church, and a very old man rings it. People who attend the church kneel on hassocks made by lady members of the church. They are embroidered with pictures of boats and swords. There is no graveyard in the church. If people want their relatives to be buried in a churchyard they have to go to{Kirdford {Church}which is three miles away.{This {is the sister church.
{The Chapel}was built in 1907 by the congregation, with bricks donated by a local lady. It is a Baptist chapel. About 12 people attend a fortnightly service.
